intro: Lilium nepalense, commonly known as the Nepal lily, is a species of flowering plant native to the Himalayan regions of Nepal, India, and Bhutan. It is characterized by its tall, slender stem and clusters of white to pale pink, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine meadows at high elevations, often in rocky or well-drained soils. Its leaves are long, narrow, and arranged in a spiral pattern along the stem. Lilium nepalense is valued for its ornamental beauty and is also used in traditional medicine in some regions.
